page.title: 03The Underwood Family
page.content: Braybrooke's oldest farming family Underwoods has records dated 1742. Joseph and Elizabeth farmed to 1900, William and Hettie daughter Freda (Goodman) and Joseph and Evelyn son Clive 1969.Today 120 hectares Top Farm, Castle Farm,Newlands and Madcraft is grassland for fattening cattle and sheep.Store cattle cost 550 pounds and lambs 40.In 1920 cattle cost 30 pounds, sheep 4,wages were 6/- rent 1 pound ten per acre.Milk was delivered to houses from a can for 21/2d per pint,skimmed pudding milk 1d and butter 2/2d per lb. 1939 wages were 2 pounds 50 but other prices lower.The war brought an increase.Fields with the exception of Madcraft,Castle Fishponds and part of Newlands were ploughed to grow barley, wheat,oats,clover and some flax pulled by hand by schoolchildren.The corn was harvested by contractors.
